events.title: Start of the Nuremberg Trials
events.description: The Nuremberg Trials begin, prosecuting prominent leaders of Nazi Germany for war crimes during World War II.
events.significance: Set a precedent for international law and justice regarding war crimes and crimes against humanity.

events.title: Death of Rock Hudson
events.description: American actor Rock Hudson dies of AIDS-related complications, becoming one of the first major celebrities to die from the disease.
events.significance: Raised awareness of AIDS and helped change public perceptions of the disease.

events.title: Princess Elizabeth Declared Heir Apparent
events.description: Princess Elizabeth is proclaimed Queen Elizabeth II, marking her status as the heir apparent to the British throne.
events.significance: Signaled the future ascension of one of the longest-reigning monarchs in British history.

events.title: United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly votes to adopt the partition plan for Palestine, proposing to divide the territory into separate Jewish and Arab states.
events.significance: Led to the creation of the state of Israel and subsequent regional conflicts.

events.title: Wallace Carothers Files for a Patent for Nylon
events.description: Wallace Carothers, a chemist at DuPont, files for a patent on nylon, the first synthetic fiber.
events.significance: Revolutionized textiles and manufacturing, introducing synthetic fibers widely used in various industries.
